contentfulPage.title: Plank 8: Stop the privatization of justice

description.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We must eliminate the practice of private companies profiting off the backs of people subject to the horrors of the criminal-legal system. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

richText.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-3","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The United States increasingly outsources the criminal-legal system to the private sector — and today, these companies profit enormously off people involved in the justice system. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This profiteering occurs at every stage of the criminal-legal process: bail, court fees, incarceration, video calls, food services, health care, parole, and probation supervision. The United States funds its “carceral state” through fines and fees that mainly fall on low-income people, disproportionately people of color, accused of criminal activity. The scale of private industry’s involvement in the criminal-legal system is staggering: Few criminal-legal functions have ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"not","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", in some way or in some jurisdiction, been commercialized by private industry.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Companies profiting from punishment make decisions that maximize their profits, even if doing so directly conflicts with public policy goals. Worse, the costs resulting from these exploitative practices are borne by our society’s most marginalized: About one in four women in the United States — and nearly one in two Black women — have a family member in prison.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We must eliminate this practice of private companies profiting off the backs of those involved in the criminal-legal system. We must build a world in which money is going to community-based organizations that support people instead of large corporations with a financial interest in maximizing the number of people subject to the horrors of the criminal-legal system.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read our policy recommendations.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

content.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"End all contracts with private prisons, jails, detention centers — including those housing immigrants and children — and probation corporations in both the federal and state criminal-legal systems.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ensure that all costs within the criminal-legal system are just and reasonable — i.e., comparable to free market prices — and prohibit kickbacks from vendors.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Require full transparency of all contracts that the government has with private corporations, including itemized costs for goods or services that are provided by private corporations and prices charged to incarcerated people or their families.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

promo1.title: End high-tech harm and the surveillance state

text.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Technology must be used to help lift people up, connect them to community-based programs, and give people access to basic necessities they need to survive and thrive.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

promo2.title: Support fair sentencing policy and end criminalization of immigrants

text.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We must build a nation where we support all people, including those who immigrate here, instead of criminalizing and imprisoning them.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
